features: Dynamic Steam Technology - The Allure iron produces over 30% more steam to quickly cut through wrinkles and create long-lasting, crisp results on clothes, linens, and more When compared to Shark GI405 and T-Fal FV4476
Auto Clean System - Keep the iron at peak performance with the Auto Clean system, which flushes out mineral deposits
Variable Temperature and Steam Controls - Independent steam and temperature controls give you the ability to customize each setting separately for the best results across all fabric types
Automatic Shutoff - For added peace of mind, the iron shuts off when left unattended for 30 seconds on its side or soleplate, and after 8 minutes on the heel rest
Stainless Steel Soleplate - The durable, heavy-duty soleplate glides smoothly over all fabric types to press out wrinkles in no time.
body.description: Blast through ironing jobs quickly and effectively with the BLACK+DECKER Allure Professional Steam Iron. Dynamic Steam technology generates 30% more steam* for crisp, professional results in no time. Customize settings according to fabric type with the variable temperature and steam controls. Dual moisture control buttons give you the power to blast tough wrinkles with steam or gently mist fabrics to dampen while ironing. Plus, the vertical steaming feature allows you to steam clothes right on the hanger for quick touchups, or steam drapes and upholstery. From ease of use to the quick, professional results, it’s no wonder the Allure iron is from BLACK+DECKER, the trusted name in clothes irons. Volts: 120V,Wattage: 1600W. Item Weight: 3.03lbs.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Black + Decker Allure Iron Specifications Auto-Cleaning: Yes Color: Blue Sole Plate Material: Stainless Steel Steam Control: Yes Warranty: 2 Year Limited Item #: D3030 Discover how the Black + Decker Allure Iron can transform your garment care. It adds a fresh, clean look to your clothes to keep you at your best in work attire and weekend wear. Dynamic Steam Technology lets you choose the temperature and amount of steam you need to deal with all types of fabrics—from durable to delicate. You can even leave clothes on the hanger while you blast away wrinkles with the vertical steam feature.

Features Vertical Steam Use the iron as a steamer for quick touch-ups right on the hanger or for curtains and drapes. Controls for Variable Temperature Five different pre-programmed temperature settings allow for a range of heat to fit all fabric types. The easy to use digital display clearly shows selected temperature and also indicates the optimal level of steam needed for each setting; taking the guesswork out of ironing. Stainless Steel Soleplate The stainless steel soleplate smoothly glides over all fabrics and resists minor scratches for lasting durability. Comfort Grip Handle Designed with ergonomic features and a special attention to comfort, the iron handle fits nicely in your hand.

Auto Clean System This feature allows you to keep your iron in optimal condition by cleaning the internal area of the soleplate; removing any debris picked up over time or light water residue. 3-Way Auto Shutoff This safety feature automatically stops heating the iron when left inactive for 8 minutes on the heel or 30 seconds on the soleplate or sides. Steam Surge Blast away tough wrinkles with the steam surge. Anti-Drip Water is heated to the proper temperature to create steam and eliminate dripping. Auto Clean System 3-Way Auto Shutoff Steam Surge Anti-Drip
Professional Dynamic Steam Advanced technology gives you over 30% more steam* to quickly cut through wrinkles for lasting, crisp results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid performing iron
reviews.reviewText: I have been purchasing the Black and Decker digital iron for last few years. They had a good life span for the price and performed great. I was a little disappointed that the model I had been buying was gone, so this was the only digital choice. I was apprehensive, but about month in, I am impressed with iron. Good weight to it without being too heavy, you can get some burst steam even at 3- which is what I liked about the old digital- given that so many items are synthetic materials now, but you really need some steam to get the wrinkles out. The new away you add water it so much better and easier than the past model. I’m glad I stuck with B & D and gave this digital model a chance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Iron for Sheets/Duvets! (Affordable too!)
reviews.reviewText: I bought a Sunbeam iron a couple years ago to replace my lightweight iron of many years, but have never liked it (clunky, not good with wrinkles). Actually, I wanted to buy THIS iron back then, but it had so many reviews citing unreliability. May still be true!But I do really like this iron! It's not too heavy & is well-designed in term of maneuverability & easy for me to hold too (I'm older.....). And no leaking or spitting or any problems with, so far...I mostly iron duvet covers & sheets, & this iron is greatly superior to the Sunbeam. Can get into small corners of fitted sheets with, and yes, that steam is quite amazing! Fogs up my glasses if I'm lifting it (& not over the ironing board). It feels & looks like a quality iron too.It's a bit hard to read the controls on the iron (but I'm mostly setting it to the same places). And hard to see water level (tho easy to pour water into it). Otherwise, it's well-designed & not overly complicated. I just pray it lasts awhile! Best iron I've had or used--& priced right, good value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Numbers hard to read
reviews.reviewText: I bought this Black & Decker iron because of my previous great experience with the brand. I am pleased with the weight and features. There is a lot of steam, and so far no issues with dripping water. What I’m unhappy with is the fact that the temperature numbers are light grey against a medium/dark grey dial. They are REALLY difficult to see. Especially since the temperature dial is right under the handle, which casts a shadow. My husband made me tiny numbered labels that I attached to the dial so that I could tell which setting I was on. The other thing missing on the iron itself is something indicating what type of fabric each temperature setting is for. There is a small pamphlet that comes with the iron that tells you this, but I don’t want to always be digging it out. Once again, my husband made me a small label with that info that I was able to a fix to the iron so that the info is always available.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent steam iron
reviews.reviewText: I really like this iron. It has a great steam capacity and the buttons for steam are user friendly. The only negative things are maybe that it is a little heavier than I expected and the dial to select the temperature range is underneath the handle, so sometimes I bump it but it isn’t a big deal.It irons very well, glides smoothly, has a good sized water reservoir, heats up fast and I like the automatic shut off when not in use.If you are looking for an iron that irons nice and puts out a lot of steam, this is it. I am very satisfied with this iron.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No more Rowenta for me! (2017 updated 2021, 2022)
reviews.reviewText: I have been using Rowenta "pro" irons for 15 or 20 years. During that time I've had four of them. Because the Rowentas have a poorly designed water tank. Every one of them would develop a leak while the thing was standing on the board, on the heel. The tanks split because the adhesive fails. Because I'm an engineer, I fixed them several times - I found replacement tanks, and then found better adhesive for the tank that failed. I paid as much for a tank as I did for this Black and Decker iron. So I tried this iron instead.Those Rowenta were three times the price of this Black and Decker. The features of this iron are very competitive with my recently-failed Rowenta Pro - identical sole plate size, stainless steel, adjustable steam, nice heft (I prefer a heavier iron), good water capacity, well designed cord strain relief. The Rowenta was 1700 watts. This one is 1600 watts. I just got through my first Shirt Ironing Marathon and the B&D did a super job. Smooth glide, good steam (even on the low setting). The Rowenta has hundreds of steam holes and this has relatively few, but even so this did a great job on my shirts.So now we'll have to see how this one lasts. My last Rowenta is now 5 years old, use it about twice a month, for 12 or 15 shirts at a time. So basically one person.Update Aug 2021This B&D iron is still going strong. No leaks. Works GREAT. Uh Buh Uh Bye Rowenta...I would suggest running through the 'cleaning blast' process occasionally. I have somewhat hard water. I use a filtration / softener gadget to help with that. But still, I have found on two or maybe three occasions over the last 4 years that it would spit white minerals (aka 'scale'). As soon as you see that, it's time to get an old towel, crank the iron to high, and press the button to blast additional water to the sole plate. Iron the towel mercilessly, blasting away with the steam. This will help release the gunk. I was AMAZED at how much gunk came out the last time, and more amazed that more of that gunk didn't end up on my shirts.So Kudos to Black and Decker for a great product at a great price.Update Sept 2022It died this morning. :( . The sole plate does not heat. There are no replacement parts for these, and they used special screws to keep the curious out. But.... HAH! I took it apart anyway. Confirmed that the heater coil is toast.Oh well... I got five good years out of it. Far longer than any of the Rowentas I'd owned. Just ordered another one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice to work with
reviews.reviewText: I iron clothing, linens, curtains and drapes. And I sew using it to iron the seams, hems, and pleats. This is an excellent iron for all I do. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The iron is of good quality. It does tend to run a little hot, so I have to turn it down one setting. It steams wonderfully and it is very easy to keep clean due to the stainless steel plate. It glides over the fabric. I like it better than my more expensive irons. It does not leak or spit water. I use this not only for ironing our everyday wear, but for when I make clothing and sewing.
Material de calidad, buen calentamiento, fácil de usar, me encanta.
It looks so cheap in hand than in photos.

A pesar de que la plancha algunas partes son de plástico es muy resistente plancha muy bien exelente vapor el tanque de agua tiene buena capacidad diferentes temperaturas la recomiendo tiene un buen precio bien empaquetada y llego antes del tiempo de entrega

Es buena, calienta pronto y tiene buen vapor lo que no me gustó es donde se encuentra el botón para cambiar el nivel de calor ya que sin querer o al presionar la plancha se apachurra y se cambia de nivel sin que lo haya seleccionado con intención y es un lío tener que comenzar a cada rato de ahí en fuera, todo bien

reviews.reviewerName: Excelente plancha, no pude decidir mejor.
reviews.reviewText: Todo me encanto, a comparación de otras planchas son más caras y la verdad no creo q sean tan buenas. Es bonita, sencilla, elegante, modena y sobre todo me llego una semana antes de la fecha de entrega
